page.title: 01Newtyle and district
page.content: Most of this area lies in the old county of Angus but parts to the north and west are in Perthshire.{ It is an agricultural area with some of the best soils in Scotland.These are loams derived from glacial drift itself formed from the underlying{Old} {Red Sandstone}of Devonian geological age. The area is situated on the northern flanks of the{Sidlaw Hills}and stretches northwards and downwards into the Vale of{Strathmore.}Strath is an old Scottish word meaning wide valley and more means large. Most of the inhabitants live in the village of Newtyle or in the scattered farms. Those who don't work in agriculture or servicing it travel to Dundee and work there. It is about 12 miles away.
